Document Title: Student Enrollment and Consent Management SOP
Organization: Harbor City Arts Lab (HCAL)
Storage: Google Drive > Programs > SOPs

1) Purpose and Audience
Why: Make sure every youth participant is properly enrolled, consents are signed, and we stay compliant with FERPA and COPPA. Who: Primary—Program Manager, Youth Programs. Backup—Lead Teaching Artist. New staff, temps, and trusted volunteers with permissions can use this.

2) Scope and Timing
Trigger: Family expresses interest or is accepted into a class. Frequency: Weekly during active enrollment; as needed for drop-ins. Duration: About 15–20 min per student across all steps (not counting waiting for signatures).

3) Roles and Coverage
- Program Manager, Youth Programs (primary): Full edit access to Airtable Students base; Jotform form owner; DocuSign sender permissions; Drive folder edit; Gmail; Slack.
- Lead Teaching Artist (backup): Edit access to Airtable Students base; send DocuSign envelopes; upload to Drive; send emails/Slack updates.
- Permissions needed: Airtable base “Students”; Jotform form “HCAL Youth Intake”; DocuSign template “HCAL Youth Consent Packet”; Google Drive > Programs > Youth > Student Files; Gmail on @harborcityartslab.org; Slack #youth-programs.

4) Tools and Systems
- Airtable (Students base): https://airtable.com/login
  Internal link: [HCAL Students Base] (paste link here)
- Jotform (Youth Intake Form): https://www.jotform.com/login
  Internal link: [HCAL Youth Intake Form] (paste link here)
- DocuSign (Consent Packet): https://www.docusign.net
  Internal link: [HCAL Youth Consent Packet Template] (paste link here)
- Google Workspace: Drive https://drive.google.com, Gmail https://mail.google.com
  Drive folder: Google Drive > Programs > Youth > Student Files > 2025
- Slack: https://slack.com/signin (#youth-programs channel)
If a tool is down:
- Airtable down → Use Google Sheet “HCAL Students — Temporary Intake” (in Drive) and enter to Airtable later.
- Jotform down → Use Google Form “Youth Intake — Backup.”
- DocuSign down → Use Google Doc “Consent Packet — Print/Email” + Adobe Fill & Sign; scan PDFs to Drive after.
- No internet → Use paper intake/consent packet; lock in office file cabinet; upload later.

5) Step-by-Step Instructions
Note: Screens to prep
- Airtable ‘Students’ Base — Enrollment Form View (screenshot placeholder)
- DocuSign Template Settings (screenshot placeholder)

1. Check inquiries (Program Manager, 2 min)
- Open Gmail and Slack #youth-programs for new interest.
- If class is full, follow Waitlist step in Troubleshooting.

2. Create/verify student in Airtable (Program Manager or Lead TA, 5 min)
- Open Airtable Students base > Enrollment Form View.
- Search for duplicates by student name + DOB. If found, reuse existing record.
- Create/complete fields: Student Name, DOB, Age, Grade, School, Program/Cohort, Session Dates, Guardian Name(s), Guardian Email/Phone, Address, Emergency Contact, Allergies/Medical, Language, Accessibility Needs, Under 13? (Y/N), Photo/Image Release (pending), FERPA Consent (pending), Status (set to “Prospect”).

3. Send intake form (Program Manager, 2 min)
- Copy Jotform link. If using prefill, add student name/program parameters.
- Email guardian via Gmail (use template A below). For under 13, email guardian only.

4. Send consent packet via DocuSign (Program Manager, 3 min)
- Open DocuSign > Templates > “HCAL Youth Consent Packet.”
- Add Recipient 1: Parent/Guardian (required). Recipient 2: Student if 18+ (optional). CC: yourself.
- Verify required docs: Liability waiver, FERPA acknowledgment, COPPA parental consent (if under 13), Image release (optional), Emergency contact verification.
- Set reminder: 3 days; expiration: 10 days. Send.

5. Track “Sent” (Lead TA or Program Manager, 1 min)
- In Airtable, update fields: Intake Form Sent (date), Consent Packet Sent (date), Status → “Pending Consents,” Due by (add 10 days).

6. Process Jotform submission (Lead TA, 5 min)
- When notified by email, open Jotform submission.
- If automation is off, copy key fields into Airtable or use CSV import. Attach PDFs to student record’s “Attachments.”

7. Process signed consents (Lead TA, 5 min)
- DocuSign completion email → download completed PDF(s).
- Save to Drive: Programs > Youth > Student Files > 2025 > Program > LastName_FirstName. Filename: 2025-ConsentPacket-Last_First.pdf.
- In Airtable: upload Drive link; set Consent Received (date), FERPA Consent = Yes, Image Release = Yes/No, Emergency Contacts Verified = Yes. Status → “Enrolled.”

8. Handle exceptions (Program Manager, 3 min)
- If Image Release = No, tag record “No Photo.”
- If FERPA not signed or restricted, tag “FERPA Limitations” and note details.

9. Reminders and waitlist (Lead TA, 2 min)
- Day 3: Send reminder email (Template B). Day 10: If still pending, Slack Program Manager and set Status → “Waitlist” unless exception approved.

10. Confirm enrollment (Program Manager, 2 min)
- Send confirmation email with schedule, arrival info, and contact (Template C).
- Post a quick update in Slack #youth-programs.

Mini-Checklist (hit these before marking Done)
- Intake form received and reviewed
- Consent packet signed and saved to Drive
- Airtable record complete and Status = Enrolled
- Photo permissions and FERPA fields updated
- Family received confirmation email
- Slack update posted

6) Definition of Done / Quality Standards
- Airtable record 100% fields complete; no duplicate.
- Consent PDF named and stored in the correct Drive folder; Drive link in Airtable.
- FERPA/COPPA and Image Release fields reflect signed docs.
- Family confirmation sent; timestamps for Sent/Received in Airtable.
- Student appears on the current class roster.

7) Troubleshooting
- Duplicate students: Merge into oldest record; keep newest attachments; note in “Notes.”
- Bounced guardian email: Call phone on file; confirm correct email; update Airtable; resend.
- No guardian email: Use paper packet or SMS link with guardian consent by phone and DocuSign to their email later.
- Under 13 with student email only: Do not email the child. Obtain guardian email/phone first (COPPA).
- Split custody: Add both guardians as recipients; require either-both signature per DocuSign template setting; log any legal restrictions.
- Class full: Set Status → Waitlist; add Waitlist Date; send waitlist email; Slack the Program Manager for seat approvals.
- Accessibility/language needs: Use Spanish forms/templates; arrange interpreter; note accommodations.

8) Data, Privacy, and Accessibility
- PII: Store only what we need; restrict access to Youth Programs team. Lock paper forms. Never email full DOB with full address in the same message.
- Retention: Keep enrollment records and consents 7 years; delete PII 3 years after last attendance if not legally required; image releases kept until revoked or program end + 3 years.
- FERPA: Treat school-shared records as confidential; don’t share student info outside staff without guardian permission or school agreement.
- COPPA (under 13): Collect info from guardians only; no direct marketing to minors; parent signs all digital consents.
- Image release: If “No Photo,” tag visibly on rosters; avoid photographing/identifying the student.
- Accessibility: Use Jotform and DocuSign accessibility options; plain language; high contrast; alt text for images; provide Spanish and large-print versions on request.

9) Communication Templates/Snippets
A) Intake + Consent Request
Subject: Action needed: Enroll [Student] in [Program]
Hi [Guardian Name], here are the two quick steps to enroll [Student]:
1) Intake form: [Jotform link]
2) Consent packet (DocuSign): arriving in a separate email today
Questions? Reply here or call [phone]. Thanks!

B) Reminder (Day 3)
Subject: Reminder: Enrollment forms for [Student]
Hi [Name], quick nudge to complete the intake and consent so we can hold [Student]’s spot. Need help? I can call or send a paper copy. Deadline: [date].

C) Enrollment Confirmation
Subject: Confirmed: [Program] enrollment for [Student]
You’re all set! Start date: [date]; Location: [address]; Arrival: [time]. Bring: [items]. If absent, text/call: [number]. Photo permission on file: [Yes/No].

10) Related Procedures and Escalation
- See: Class Roster & Attendance SOP; Incident Reporting SOP; Media & Photo Use SOP; Data Retention & Deletion SOP.
- Escalate to: Program Manager, Youth Programs (Slack DM or email). If legal/compliance questions, ping Director of Programs.

11) Version Control
- Author: Priya Desai
- Process Owner: Program Manager, Youth Programs
- Approver: Robert Chen, Director of Programs
- Version: 1.0
- Effective Date: 08/15/2025
- Next Review Date: 08/15/2026
- Storage Location: Google Drive > Programs > SOPs

12) Signature Lines
Process Owner Approval: ______________________ Date: ________
Janelle Brooks, Program Manager, Youth Programs

Executive Approval: __________________________ Date: ________
Robert Chen, Director of Programs

End of SOP. Insert screenshots where noted.

evaluation.reasoning: This is an exceptionally strong SOP that successfully balances casual tone with professional rigor. It addresses the complex compliance landscape (FERPA, COPPA, image releases) in accessible language while providing concrete, actionable steps. The document demonstrates deep understanding of nonprofit youth program operations and would be immediately usable by staff.
strengths: Tone execution is perfect—casual but not unprofessional, with phrases like 'quick nudge' and 'You're all set!' that feel authentic to nonprofit culture while maintaining clarity
Excellent troubleshooting section that addresses real-world scenarios (split custody, bounced emails, COPPA violations, full classes) with specific solutions rather than vague guidance
Outstanding attention to compliance details—correctly distinguishes FERPA, COPPA (under 13), and image release requirements with practical implementation steps
Highly practical backup systems for each tool, including offline/paper alternatives that recognize resource constraints
Communication templates are realistic, warm, and appropriately brief—they sound like actual nonprofit staff emails
Time estimates for each step (2-5 min) make workload transparent and help with capacity planning
Data privacy section is sophisticated, covering retention schedules, PII handling, and accessibility in plain language
Mini-checklist provides quick reference without re-reading entire procedure
Appropriate use of casual formatting (bullets, dashes, abbreviations like 'TA') that aids scannability
weaknesses: The 'Under 13 with student email only' troubleshooting item could be clearer—it says 'obtain guardian email/phone first' but doesn't specify the exact workflow if you only have student contact initially
Screenshot placeholders are mentioned but only two are specified; key steps like Jotform submission review or Drive folder structure could benefit from additional visual aids
The automation mention in step 6 ('If automation is off') assumes knowledge of Jotform-Airtable integration that isn't explained in the Tools section
Minor: The document is approximately 1,100 words, slightly exceeding the 500-900 word target (though the prompt allows up to 1,000 for complex processes, which this is)

Here is the formal Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Letters and IRS Tax Receipts at Bay & Basin Conservancy:

---

**STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE: Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Letters and IRS Tax Receipts**

**1) Purpose and Audience**
This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) details the process for generating and distributing monthly donor acknowledgment letters and IRS tax receipts. This document ensures compliance with IRS regulations, donor stewardship best practices, and organizational consistency, particularly for new staff, temporary coverage, and cross-training purposes.

**2) Scope and Timing**
This procedure is triggered at the close of each calendar month for all recurring donations processed within that month. The process is performed monthly, typically within the first five (5) business days of the subsequent month. The expected duration for this task is approximately 2-4 hours, depending on the volume of monthly donors.

**3) Roles and Coverage**
The primary responsibility for executing this SOP rests with the **Donor Relations Manager**. In the absence of the primary role, the **Development Operations Analyst** will act as coverage. Both roles require full administrative access to Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT, editing permissions for relevant SharePoint folders, and full access to Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, Word, DocuSign).

**4) Tools and Systems**

*   **Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT:** Donor database and gift management.
    *   Access: Log in at [https://app.blackbaud.com/](https://app.blackbaud.com/) using organizational credentials.
    *   Low-cost alternative (if primary system down): Utilize the "Backup Donor Data (Monthly Recurring)" Excel file located in SharePoint > Development > Donor Data > Backups, and process acknowledgments manually using the Word template. Update Raiser's Edge NXT upon system restoration.
*   **Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word):** Email communication and document generation.
    *   Access: Log in at [https://www.office.com/](https://www.office.com/) with organizational credentials.
*   **SharePoint:** Document storage, SOPs, and acknowledgment letter templates.
    *   Access: Log in at [https://bayandbasin.sharepoint.com/](https://bayandbasin.sharepoint.com/) with organizational credentials.
*   **DocuSign:** Secure electronic signature for official tax receipts, if required.
    *   Access: Log in at [https://account.docusign.com/](https://account.docusign.com/) with organizational credentials.

**5) Step-by-Step Instructions**

1.  **Extract Monthly Donor Data (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   Navigate to Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT.
    *   Go to "Gifts" > "Gift Batches."
    *   Create a new query for "Recurring Gifts Processed in [Previous Month]." Filter by "Gift Date" between the 1st and last day of the previous month and "Gift Type" = "Recurring Gift."
    *   Export the query results, including donor name, address, gift amount, gift date, and constituent ID.
    *   Estimated Time: 15 minutes.
2.  **Generate Acknowledgment Queue (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   Within Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT, navigate to "Appeal" > "Acknowledgment Letters."
    *   Click "Add" to create a new acknowledgment queue.
    *   Name the queue "Monthly Acks [Previous Month Year]" (e.g., "Monthly Acks January 2025").
    *   Select the query created in Step 1.
    *   Ensure "Send via email" is selected if preferred, or "Print" for physical mail.
    *   Estimated Time: 10 minutes.
3.  **Perform Mail Merge for Letters (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   From the acknowledgment queue, select "Generate Letters."
    *   Choose the "Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Template" from the available templates. (Placeholder: *Raiser's Edge NXT Mail Merge Template selection screen*).
    *   Review the merge fields to ensure accuracy (e.g., donor name, aggregate monthly total).
    *   Generate the merged documents into a Microsoft Word file.
    *   Estimated Time: 30 minutes.
4.  **Review and Edit Letters (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   Open the generated Microsoft Word document.
    *   Conduct a thorough review for any merging errors, formatting issues, or specific donor notes that may require customization.
    *   Save the finalized document as "Monthly Donor Acks [Previous Month Year].docx" in SharePoint > Development > Donor Communications > Acknowledgments > [Year].
    *   Estimated Time: 45 minutes.
5.  **Generate IRS Tax Receipts (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   For donations meeting the threshold requiring specific IRS disclosures (currently $250 or more for individual gifts, or aggregate for monthly donors if it exceeds this and a single receipt is desired), create separate IRS-compliant receipts.
    *   Utilize the "IRS Tax Receipt Template.docx" located in SharePoint > Development > Templates.
    *   Merge relevant data from the exported donor list (Step 1) into this template.
    *   Generate individual PDFs for each donor requiring a specific tax receipt.
    *   Estimated Time: 30 minutes.
6.  **Secure Electronic Signatures (if applicable, Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   If official signatures are required for IRS tax receipts (e.g., for very large gifts or specific funder agreements), upload the generated PDFs to DocuSign.
    *   Route for signature to the Chief Development Officer.
    *   Estimated Time: 15 minutes.
7.  **Distribute Acknowledgment Letters and Receipts (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   **Email:** For donors with an email preference, convert the Word document to PDF and attach to a new email. Use the "Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Email Template" (see Step 9). Attach the individual IRS tax receipt if applicable.
    *   **Mail:** For donors with a mail preference, print the letters and receipts. Prepare for mailing, including folding, stuffing, and postage.
    *   Estimated Time: 60 minutes.
8.  **Update Raiser's Edge NXT Records (Donor Relations Manager):**
    *   Navigate back to the acknowledgment queue in Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT.
    *   Mark all processed acknowledgments as "Acknowledged" with the current date.
    *   Add a note to each recurring gift record confirming "Monthly acknowledgment letter and receipt sent [Date]."
    *   Estimated Time: 20 minutes.

    **Mini-Checklist:**
    *   ✓ All monthly donors identified in query.
    *   ✓ Acknowledgment letters generated and reviewed.
    *   ✓ IRS tax receipts generated (if applicable).
    *   ✓ All documents distributed via preferred method.
    *   ✓ Raiser's Edge NXT updated for all acknowledged gifts.

**6) Definition of Done / Quality Standards**
The process is considered complete when:
*   ✓ All monthly donors from the previous month have received an acknowledgment letter.
*   ✓ All donors requiring an IRS tax receipt have received one, either within the acknowledgment letter or as a separate document.
*   ✓ All acknowledgment documents are saved as PDFs in SharePoint > Development > Donor Communications > Acknowledgments > [Year] > [Month].
*   ✓ The "Acknowledgments" queue in Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT is cleared with all gifts marked as acknowledged.
*   ✓ Individual gift records in Raiser's Edge NXT are updated with the acknowledgment date.

**7) Troubleshooting**
*   **If Gift Not Appearing in Query:** Verify gift entry date and type. If an error, correct the gift record in Raiser's Edge NXT, then re-run the query.
*   **If Mail Merge Error:** Check donor records for missing or incorrect fields (e.g., blank address). Correct data and regenerate. If persistent, restart the merge process.
*   **If Donor Declines a Receipt:** Note this preference clearly in the Raiser's Edge NXT constituent record's "Comments" section. Send a warm thank-you only, omitting any tax receipt language.
*   **If System Outage (Raiser's Edge NXT):** Utilize the "Backup Donor Data (Monthly Recurring)" Excel file in SharePoint. Generate letters and receipts using the Word templates manually. Keep a log of all actions taken and update Raiser's Edge NXT retrospectively upon system restoration.
*   **If Template Corruption:** Access the master templates in SharePoint > Development > Templates > Master Copies. Do not edit master copies directly. Create a new working copy from the master.

**8) Data, Privacy, and Accessibility**
*   **PII Handling:** All personally identifiable information (PII) of donors must be handled with the utmost confidentiality. Access to donor data is restricted to authorized personnel. Data must not be shared outside Bay & Basin Conservancy unless explicitly permitted by the donor or required by law.
*   **IRS Charitable Contribution Receipt Rules:** Adhere strictly to IRS Publication 1771, Charitable Contributions — Substantiation and Disclosure Requirements. Ensure all receipts accurately state Bay & Basin Conservancy's 501(c)(3) status and the absence of goods or services provided in exchange for the donation (or clearly state their value if applicable).
*   **GDPR (EU Donors):** For donors identified as residents of the European Union, ensure their explicit consent for communication and data processing has been recorded in Raiser's Edge NXT. Acknowledgment letters and receipts must respect their preferences.
*   **CCPA (California Residents):** For donors identified as California residents, ensure appropriate disclosures and options regarding their data privacy rights are made available if engaged in broader data processing activities.
*   **Language Access:** While standard templates are in English, if a donor specifically requests communication in Spanish, dedicated "Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Letter - Spanish" and "IRS Tax Receipt - Spanish" templates are available in SharePoint > Development > Templates.

**9) Communication Templates/Snippets**

**Email Subject Line:** Your Monthly Gift to Bay & Basin Conservancy – Thank You!

**Email Body Template:**
Subject: Your Monthly Gift to Bay & Basin Conservancy – Thank You!

Dear [Donor Name],

Thank you for your generous recurring monthly gift of [Aggregate Monthly Total] to Bay & Basin Conservancy in [Previous Month]. Your continued support is vital to our efforts in [briefly state mission focus, e.g., protecting coastal wetlands and educating the next generation of environmental stewards].

Please find your official acknowledgment letter and tax receipt for your records attached.

We are deeply grateful for your dedication to Bay & Basin Conservancy.

Sincerely,

The Team at Bay & Basin Conservancy
[Your Website Link]

**10) Related Procedures and Escalation**
*   **Related Procedures:**
    *   SOP: Gift Entry and Processing (SharePoint > Development > SOPs)
    *   SOP: Donor Data Management and Corrections (SharePoint > Development > SOPs)
*   **Escalation:** For technical issues with Raiser's Edge NXT, contact the IT Support Desk at [IT Support Email] or extension [IT Support Phone Number]. For policy or complex donor relations questions, contact Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer, via Outlook or extension [CDO Phone Number].

---

**11) Version Control**
Author: Diego Morales
Process Owner: Donor Relations Manager
Approver: Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer
Version: 2.3
Effective Date: 01/31/2025
Next Review Date: 01/31/2026
Storage Location: SharePoint > Development > SOPs

**12) Signature Lines**
Process Owner Approval: ______________________ Date: ________
Elena Park, Donor Relations Manager

Executive Approval: __________________________ Date: ________
Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer

---

Title: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) — Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Letters and IRS Tax Receipts
Organization: Bay & Basin Conservancy
Document Type: Word/Google Doc with headers, numbered steps, checklist, and space for screenshots

1) Purpose and Audience
This procedure ensures all monthly donors receive accurate, timely acknowledgment letters and IRS-compliant tax receipts, preserving donor trust and regulatory compliance. It is intended for the Donor Relations Manager; coverage is provided by the Development Operations Analyst when needed, and for onboarding of new staff or temporary support.

2) Scope and Timing
- Trigger: Recurring (monthly) gifts recorded in Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge NXT (RE NXT).
- Frequency: Weekly processing; all gifts acknowledged within 48 hours of gift entry; monthly sweep on the 1st–3rd business day to catch any stragglers from the prior month.
- Duration: Approximately 15 minutes per 10 gifts (includes QA, merge, send, and CRM updates).

3) Roles and Coverage
- Primary: Donor Relations Manager (requires RE NXT gifts add/edit, Acknowledgements, Export, and Attachment permissions; Microsoft 365; SharePoint edit; DocuSign sender).
- Coverage: Development Operations Analyst (same access as above).
- Optional Review: Chief Development Officer review for gifts ≥ $1,000 or complex cases (e.g., quid pro quo, donor-advised funds).

4) Tools and Systems
- Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge NXT: https://renxt.blackbaud.com (log in via https://login.blackbaud.com with @baybasin.org credentials).
- Microsoft 365:
  - Outlook: https://outlook.office.com
  - Word: https://portal.office.com > Word
- SharePoint (storage and templates): https://portal.office.com > SharePoint > Bay & Basin Conservancy > Development > SOPs; receipts saved under SharePoint > Development > Donor Receipts > 2025 > Monthly.
- DocuSign: https://account.docusign.com (SSO with @baybasin.org).
Low-cost/contingency alternatives if primary tool is down:
- If RE NXT is unavailable: Export processor/bank report, record gifts in a temporary Excel log (SharePoint > Development > Temp Logs > Gift Log.xlsx), generate receipts using the Word mail merge template, and backfill RE NXT within 24 hours of restoration.
- If SharePoint is unavailable: Save PDFs locally in an encrypted OneDrive folder and upload once SharePoint is restored.

5) Step-by-Step Instructions
Note: Insert screenshots where indicated.

1. Identify Gifts (RE NXT) — 5 minutes
   - Role: Donor Relations Manager (or backup).
   - Navigate: RE NXT > Gifts > Gift Lists.
   - Filter: Gift Type = Recurring; Date = last 2–3 business days; Acknowledgement Status = Not Acknowledged.
   - Save list as “Monthly Donors – Pending Receipts.”
   - [Placeholder: Screenshot — Raiser's Edge NXT Gift Batch — Acknowledgments Queue]

2. Quality Check Donor Records — 5 minutes per 10 gifts
   - Confirm donor name, primary email and/or mailing address, tribute/soft credit, and restrictions.
   - If address or email missing, search household constituents; if still missing, set Delivery Method = Print and create a Task to request update from donor.
   - For gifts ≥ $1,000: Notify CDO via Outlook (cc: Executive Director).

3. Queue Acknowledgments — 5–10 minutes
   - RE NXT > Tools > Acknowledgements (or Database View > Mail > Acknowledgements).
   - Select Template: “2025 Monthly Donor Receipt – Standard.”
   - Include: All gifts from “Monthly Donors – Pending Receipts.”
   - Verify “Receipt Date” = today; “Letter Code” = Monthly Receipt.
   - [Placeholder: Screenshot — Acknowledgments Queue options]

4. Generate Merge File and Letters — 10 minutes
   - Click Generate > Export merge file (CSV).
   - Open Word > Mailings > Select Recipients > Use Existing List > select the exported CSV.
   - Open template: SharePoint > Development > Templates > Acknowledgments > “2025 Monthly Donor Receipt – Standard.docx.”
   - Fields required by IRS: Donor name, donation date, amount, description (“monthly recurring gift”), Bay & Basin Conservancy name and EIN, statement of goods/services, and any goods/services value if quid pro quo.
   - [Placeholder: Screenshot — Mail Merge Template field mapping]

5. Create Accessible PDFs — 5 minutes
   - Finish & Merge to Individual Documents.
   - Review formatting; ensure alt text on logo and tagged headings if possible.
   - Save as PDFs to SharePoint > Development > Donor Receipts > 2025 > Monthly > YYYY-MM-DD Batch.

6. Send Receipts — 10–20 minutes
   - Email method (default): Outlook > From development@baybasin.org.
     - Subject: Your tax receipt from Bay & Basin Conservancy
     - Attach individual PDF; BCC development@baybasin.org for archive.
   - If donor requested e-sign acknowledgement: Send via DocuSign with receipt PDF and standard message.
   - If no email: Print and mail within 2 business days (insert #10 envelopes, print on letterhead).

7. Update RE NXT — 10 minutes
   - Gifts: Mark Acknowledged = Yes; set Receipt Date; Method = Email or Mail.
   - Add Action: “Receipt sent [date], method [Email/Mail], file saved to SharePoint path.”
   - Attach PDF to constituent record if policy requires (link or upload).

8. Exceptions and Decision Points
   - Donor in EU or CA: Confirm consent preference; include privacy footer (see Section 8).
   - Quid pro quo: Insert goods/services description and fair market value; adjust deductibility text.
   - In-kind gifts: Do not state a dollar value; describe property only.

9. Mini-Checklist (Critical)
   - Gifts filtered for “Not Acknowledged” and “Recurring.”
   - IRS content present and correct.
   - PDFs saved to correct SharePoint folder, named “LastName_FirstName_YYYYMMDD_Receipt.pdf.”
   - RE NXT fields updated; Action logged.
   - High-value or complex gifts escalated.

6) Definition of Done / Quality Standards
- Receipt PDFs saved in SharePoint > Development > Donor Receipts > 2025 > Monthly, correctly named.
- RE NXT gift records show Acknowledged = Yes; Receipt Date and Method populated; Action note added.
- Emails sent or letters mailed; sent emails archived via BCC.
- No gifts remain in “Monthly Donors – Pending Receipts” list for the period.

7) Troubleshooting
- If donor requests annual consolidated receipt: Update donor preference in RE NXT (Constituent > Attributes: “Annual Receipt Only = Yes”); suppress monthly tax language and send thank-you only; schedule annual statement by Jan 31.
- If donor declines a receipt: Note “Declined Receipt” attribute; send thank-you without IRS language.
- If duplicate receipts were sent: Email apology with corrected receipt; annotate RE NXT Action “Corrected receipt sent.”
- If pledge/sustainer charge failed then succeeded later: Use transaction date of settled gift; do not acknowledge failed attempts.
- If name/address typo: Correct in RE NXT; regenerate and resend receipt; log Action “Amended receipt.”
- If RE NXT merge fields misalign: Re-map fields in Word > Match Fields; verify column headers.

8) Data, Privacy, and Accessibility
- Compliance: Follow IRS charitable contribution receipt rules; include organization name, EIN, date, amount, and goods/services statement. For quid pro quo, state value received.
- GDPR: For EU donors, send receipts only to contacts with valid lawful basis; honor data subject rights; minimize PII in email body; attach PDFs securely.
- CCPA: Provide opt-out and privacy notice link in email footer for CA residents; limit data sharing.
- Retention: Store receipts for 7 years in SharePoint with restricted access (Development only).
- Accessibility: Use tagged PDFs, high-contrast templates, readable fonts (≥12pt). Offer Spanish and large-print versions upon request.

9) Communication Templates/Snippets
- Email (Default)
  Subject: Your tax receipt from Bay & Basin Conservancy
  Body: Thank you for your monthly gift on [Date] of $[Amount] supporting Bay & Basin Conservancy’s mission. Attached is your IRS-compliant receipt. No goods or services were provided in exchange for this contribution. EIN: [EIN]. For questions or a consolidated annual receipt, reply to this email.

- Email (Amended Receipt)
  Subject: Corrected tax receipt from Bay & Basin Conservancy
  Body: Please find an amended receipt reflecting corrected information for your [Date] gift. We apologize for the error.

- Mail Footer (Privacy)
  Privacy: Bay & Basin Conservancy respects your privacy. For EU/California notices, visit [Privacy Policy URL].

10) Related Procedures and Escalation
- Related SOPs: Gift Entry, Donor Record Corrections, Returned Mail Handling, Data Privacy & Retention, Annual Consolidated Receipts.
- Escalation:
  - Content/thank-you language: Donor Relations Manager (Microsoft Teams/Outlook).
  - Compliance/edge cases: Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer.
  - System access/issues: Development Operations Analyst; IT support via Microsoft 365 Admin.

11) Version Control
- Author: Diego Morales
- Process Owner: Donor Relations Manager
- Approver: Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer
- Version: 2.3
- Effective Date: 01/31/2025
- Next Review Date: 01/31/2026
- Storage Location: SharePoint > Development > SOPs

12) Signature Lines
Process Owner Approval: ______________________ Date: ________
Elena Park, Donor Relations Manager

Executive Approval: __________________________ Date: ________
Sandra Liu, Chief Development Officer

outputs.content:
# STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE
## Monthly Donor Acknowledgment Letters and IRS Tax Receipts

**Bay & Basin Conservancy**

---

## 1. PURPOSE AND AUDIENCE

This SOP ensures all monthly donors receive timely, compliant acknowledgment letters and IRS-compliant tax receipts in accordance with federal charitable contribution reporting requirements. It standardizes the monthly cycle of donor recognition, reduces risk of non-compliance, and preserves institutional knowledge when staff transition. Primary user: Donor Relations Manager. Backup: Development Operations Analyst.

---

## 2. SCOPE AND TIMING

**Trigger:** First business day of each month for prior month's contributions.

**Frequency:** Monthly, on or before the 5th business day of the month.

**Duration:** Approximately 90–120 minutes for 50–150 monthly donors.

**Fiscal Year:** Calendar year (January–December).

---

## 3. ROLES AND COVERAGE

**Primary:** Donor Relations Manager – Responsible for generating, reviewing, and distributing all monthly acknowledgment letters and tax receipts.

**Backup:** Development Operations Analyst – Executes procedure when Donor Relations Manager is unavailable; must have equivalent system access.

**Required Access:**
- Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT: Query and Export permissions
- Microsoft 365: Outlook (send), Word (merge), SharePoint (read/write to Development folder)
- DocuSign: Sender permissions for署名-required receipts (major gifts ≥$5,000)

---

## 4. TOOLS AND SYSTEMS

| **Tool** | **Access Point** | **Backup/Alternative** |
|----------|------------------|------------------------|
| Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT | https://login.blackbaud.com | Manual Excel export; sync upon restoration |
| Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word) | https://outlook.office.com | Gmail (development@baybaisin.org) with plain-text templates |
| SharePoint | https://baybasin.sharepoint.com/sites/Development/SOPs | Local desktop backup folder: C:\BB_SOPs |
| DocuSign | https://app.docusign.com | Wet signature + scan for urgent cases |

**Template Locations:**
- Word mail merge template: SharePoint > Development > Templates > Monthly_Acknowledgment_Letter_2025.docx
- IRS tax receipt template: SharePoint > Development > Templates > IRS_Tax_Receipt_2025.docx

---

## 5. STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

**Total Steps: 12 | Estimated Time: 90–120 minutes**

### A. Data Extraction (15 minutes)

**Step 1.** Log in to Raiser's Edge NXT at https://login.blackbaud.com using @baybasin.org credentials.

**Step 2.** Navigate to **Records > Gifts > Acknowledgments Queue** (bookmark this view for recurring use).

**Step 3.** Filter by:
   - Gift Date: First day to last day of prior month (e.g., for January letters, filter 12/01/2024–12/31/2024)
   - Gift Type: All revenue types except pledges and in-kind (non-cash)
   - Acknowledgment Status: "Not Acknowledged"

**Step 4.** Export results to Excel: Click **Actions > Export > Excel (with all fields)**. Save file as `YYYYMM_DonorAcknowledgments_Export.xlsx` to SharePoint > Development > Monthly Receipts > 2025.

**Decision Point:** If export contains fewer than 10 records and month had known campaigns, verify gift entry completion with Development Operations Analyst before proceeding.

---

### B. Data Review and Segmentation (20 minutes)

**Step 5.** Open exported Excel file. Review for data quality:
   - Confirm all donor names, addresses, and email fields are populated.
   - Flag any PO Box addresses for physical mail; email-only donors receive digital receipts.
   - Identify gifts ≥$1,000: These require personalized acknowledgment (see Step 9).

**Step 6.** Create two Excel tabs by copying records:
   - **Tab 1:** "Standard Receipts" (<$1,000; n=~130)
   - **Tab 2:** "Personalized Letters" (≥$1,000; n=~15–20)

**Step 7.** For **each tab**, verify IRS-compliant fields are complete:
   - Donor legal name (individual or organization)
   - Gift amount (USD)
   - Gift date
   - "No goods or services were provided in exchange" statement (auto-generated in template)
   - Bay & Basin Conservancy EIN: 94-1234567

---

### C. Mail Merge – Standard Receipts (30 minutes)

**Step 8.** Open `Monthly_Acknowledgment_Letter_2025.docx` from SharePoint > Development > Templates.

**Step 9.** In Word, select **Mailings > Select Recipients > Use Existing List**. Browse to `YYYYMM_DonorAcknowledgments_Export.xlsx`, Tab 1 ("Standard Receipts").

**Step 10.** Preview merge fields:
   - **<<FirstName>> <<LastName>>** in salutation
   - **<<GiftAmount>>** formatted as currency
   - **<<GiftDate>>** formatted as MM/DD/YYYY
   - **<<FundName>>** (General Operating, Marine Habitat Restoration, etc.)

**Step 11.** Complete merge: **Mailings > Finish & Merge > Edit Individual Documents > All**. Save merged file as `YYYYMM_Standard_Receipts_MERGED.docx` in SharePoint > Development > Monthly Receipts > 2025.

**Step 12.** Convert to PDF: **File > Save As > PDF**. File name: `YYYYMM_Standard_Receipts.pdf`.

---

### D. Personalized Letters – Major Gifts (25 minutes)

**Step 13.** For each donor in Tab 2 ("Personalized Letters"), open a **new** Word document from template `IRS_Tax_Receipt_2025.docx`.

**Step 14.** Manually insert:
   - Donor name and mailing address
   - Personal note (1–2 sentences) referencing donor history or program impact; consult Raiser's Edge NXT biographical notes under **Records > Constituents > [Donor Name] > Notes**.
   - Gift details and EIN as in Step 7.

**Step 15.** Save each letter individually: `YYYYMM_LastName_FirstName_Receipt.pdf` in SharePoint > Development > Monthly Receipts > 2025 > Personalized.

**Decision Point:** Gifts ≥$5,000 require Development Director co-signature via DocuSign. Upload PDF to DocuSign, route to Sandra Liu (sliu@baybasin.org) for signature, then to donor.

---

### E. Distribution (20 minutes)

**Step 16.** **Email distribution (primary method):**
   - Attach `YYYYMM_Standard_Receipts.pdf` (mail-merged, individual pages).
   - Use Outlook mail merge to send individual emails with Section 9 template ("Subject: Your January 2025 tax receipt…").
   - BCC: receipts@baybasin.org (archive).

**Step 17.** **Physical mail (PO Box addresses or donor preference "Mail Only" flag in CRM):**
   - Print letters on Bay & Basin letterhead (stored in supply cabinet, Rm 204).
   - Hand-sign in blue ink (Donor Relations Manager signature).
   - Mail via USPS First Class within 2 business days.

**Step 18.** Update Raiser's Edge NXT for all gifts:
   - Navigate to **Records > Gifts > [Gift ID]**.
   - Mark **Acknowledgment Status: Acknowledged**.
   - Enter **Acknowledgment Date:** [Date letters sent].
   - Add Note: "Monthly receipt sent via [email/mail] on [MM/DD/YYYY]."

---

### F. Final Checklist

Before marking complete, confirm:

- [ ] All gifts from prior month exported and segmented
- [ ] IRS-required fields verified (name, amount, date, EIN, no-goods-or-services statement)
- [ ] Standard receipts merged, converted to PDF, and saved to SharePoint
- [ ] Personalized letters drafted, saved individually, routed for signature if ≥$5,000
- [ ] Emails sent with individual attachments; physical letters mailed
- [ ] Raiser's Edge NXT acknowledgment status updated for 100% of gifts
- [ ] Archive copy sent to receipts@baybasin.org

---

## 6. DEFINITION OF DONE / QUALITY STANDARDS

Procedure is complete when:

- ✓ Every gift from the prior month (per Acknowledgments Queue filter) has **Acknowledgment Status = "Acknowledged"** and **Acknowledgment Date** populated in Raiser's Edge NXT.
- ✓ All receipts (standard and personalized) saved as PDFs in SharePoint > Development > Monthly Receipts > 2025 > [Month].
- ✓ Email confirmations received (Outlook "Sent" folder) or physical mail postmarked within 2 business days.
- ✓ Gifts ≥$5,000 have DocuSign completion certificate attached in Raiser's Edge NXT Documents tab.
- ✓ Zero outstanding items in Acknowledgments Queue for the processed month.

**Quality Standards:**
- Zero typographical errors in donor names, amounts, or dates.
- 100% IRS compliance (all required elements present per IRS Pub 1771).
- Receipts delivered within 5 business days of month-end.

---

## 7. TROUBLESHOOTING

| **Issue** | **Solution** |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Raiser's Edge NXT unavailable** | Use prior month's Excel export as template; manually add new gifts from gift entry log (Google Sheet backup). Sync to RE NXT upon restoration. Notify Development Operations Analyst. |
| **Donor email bounces** | Check CRM for alternate email. If none, mail physical letter to address on file. Update email status to "Undeliverable" in RE NXT. |
| **Donor requests receipt re-send** | Retrieve PDF from SharePoint archive; re-send via email same business day. Log request in RE NXT Notes: "Receipt re-sent [date] per donor request." |
| **Missing gift data (no amount or date)** | Do not generate receipt. Escalate to Development Operations Analyst to correct gift record. Re-run export after correction. |
| **Donor declines receipt** | Note in RE NXT: "Donor declined receipt [date]." Send thank-you email only (no tax receipt language). Tag constituent: "No Receipt Preferred." |
| **International donor (non-U.S. address)** | Include standard IRS receipt language. Add note: "Deductibility subject to donor's local tax law; consult tax advisor." For EU donors, apply GDPR data retention (see Section 8). |
| **Gift marked "Anonymous"** | Generate receipt with salutation "Dear Friend" and mail to "Anonymous Donor, c/o Bay & Basin Conservancy" unless alternate address provided in Notes. Do not email. |

---

## 8. DATA, PRIVACY, AND ACCESSIBILITY

**Regulatory Compliance:**

- **IRS Charitable Contribution Rules (Pub 1771):** All receipts must include donor name, gift amount, date, organization EIN (94-1234567), and statement: "No goods or services were provided in exchange for this contribution" (or description and good-faith estimate if goods/services provided). Retain receipts for 7 years.
  
- **GDPR (EU Donors):** Donors residing in EU member states: Obtain explicit consent to store personal data (email, address). Provide opt-out link in acknowledgment emails. Retain data only as long as donor relationship is active + 2 years. Deletion requests honored within 30 days (contact privacy@baybasin.org).

- **CCPA (California Residents):** Donors residing in California: Provide annual notice of data collection and right to opt out of sale (Bay & Basin does not sell data). Include link in email footer: "California Privacy Rights: [link]."

**Data Handling:**

- Export files containing PII (names, addresses, gift amounts) are stored in SharePoint with restricted access (Development team only; no public links).
- Delete local desktop copies of Excel exports after upload to SharePoint.
- Physical letters stored in locked filing cabinet (Rm 204) for current year; archived off-site after 2 years.

**Language Access:**

- Spanish-language receipt template available: `IRS_Tax_Receipt_2025_ES.docx` (SharePoint > Development > Templates).
- Flag Spanish-preferred donors in RE NXT with constituent code "ES-Preferred"; use Spanish template for those records.

**Accessibility:**

- PDF receipts are text-readable (not scanned images) for screen-reader compatibility.
- Font: Minimum 11pt, sans-serif (Calibri).
- Email subject lines are descriptive for low-vision readers ("Your January 2025 tax receipt from Bay & Basin Conservancy").

---

## 9. COMMUNICATION TEMPLATES/SNIPPETS

### Template A: Standard Email with Receipt (Email Body)

**Subject:** Your January 2025 Tax Receipt from Bay & Basin Conservancy

---

Dear [FirstName],

Thank you for your generous gift of $[GiftAmount] to Bay & Basin Conservancy on [GiftDate]. Your support advances our mission to protect and restore coastal ecosystems for future generations.

Attached is your IRS-compliant tax receipt for your records. Bay & Basin Conservancy is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization (EIN: 94-1234567), and your contribution is tax-deductible to the fullest extent permitted by law.

If you have questions about your gift or this receipt, please contact our Development team at development@baybasin.org or (555) 123-4567.

With gratitude,

Elena Park  
Donor Relations Manager  
Bay & Basin Conservancy  
www.baybasin.org

---

**California Privacy Rights:** [link]  
**Unsubscribe or update preferences:** [link]

---

### Template B: Physical Letter Re-send Request (Email Reply)

**Subject:** Re: Receipt Request

---

Dear [FirstName],

Thank you for reaching out. I have re-sent your [Month Year] tax receipt to this email address. Please allow a few moments for delivery and check your spam folder if it does not arrive.

If you prefer a mailed copy, please reply with your current mailing address and I will send it via USPS within two business days.

Best regards,

Elena Park  
Donor Relations Manager  
development@baybasin.org | (555) 123-4567

---

### Template C: Personalized Major Gift Acknowledgment (Letter Insert)

[Date]

Dear [Mr./Ms. LastName],

On behalf of the Board of Directors and the entire Bay & Basin Conservancy team, thank you for your exceptional gift of $[GiftAmount] on [GiftDate]. 

[Personal note: 1–2 sentences referencing donor history, program supported, or recent impact. evaluation.reasoning: This is an exceptionally well-crafted SOP that demonstrates deep understanding of nonprofit development operations. It perfectly balances formal tone with practical usability, includes all required sections with appropriate detail, and provides actionable steps a new staff member could follow immediately. Minor deductions only for a small compliance detail and length slightly exceeding the suggested range.
strengths: Exemplary formal tone throughout—professional, policy-ready language appropriate for board/funder review without being stilted or inaccessible
Outstanding step-by-step instructions with precise time estimates, decision points, and concrete actions (e.g., 'Click Actions > Export > Excel')
Excellent compliance integration—IRS Pub 1771, GDPR, and CCPA requirements woven naturally into workflow rather than treated as afterthought
Highly practical troubleshooting section with realistic scenarios (bounced emails, anonymous donors, international gifts) and clear solutions
Strong data segmentation logic (standard vs. personalized, <$1,000 vs. ≥$1,000) that reflects actual nonprofit development practice
Professional communication templates that are genuinely usable and appropriately warm within formal context
Comprehensive version control with realistic revision history showing iterative improvement
Excellent use of tables for tools/systems, troubleshooting, and escalation contacts—enhances scannability
Thoughtful backup/alternative systems for each tool (e.g., Gmail fallback, manual Excel export)
Realistic time estimates (90-120 min for 50-150 donors) based on actual workflow complexity
weaknesses: Length exceeds suggested 500-900 word range at approximately 2,400 words—though this may be justified for a complex, compliance-heavy process at a large organization

Minor technical detail: The IRS 'no goods or services' statement should technically read 'No goods or services were provided in exchange for this contribution, other than intangible religious benefits' for religious orgs, or the exact language should be 'in whole or in part'—the current phrasing is slightly informal for strict IRS compliance

The DocuSign signature requirement for gifts ≥$5,000 is unusual in practice—most nonprofits don't require co-signatures on routine tax receipts, even for major gifts; this may create unnecessary bottleneck
Screenshot placeholders mentioned in prompt quality guidelines are referenced in values but not consistently called out in the step-by-step (only mentioned once in Step 3 area)
